arts.ttl: Player Ratings Poll: Bayern Munich 0 - 1 Leverkusen in the DFB-Pokal
arts.sum: As for Leverkusen, and red-hot coaching prospect Xabi Alonso...they probably needed this result. Looking for more thoughts and analysis on Bayern Munich’s shocking 1-0 loss to Bayer Leverkusen in the DFB-Pokal?

arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Bayer Leverkusen in the DFB-Pokal; Real Madrid to bring back Casemiro?; Harry Kane, Jamal Musiala honored; FC Barcelona eyeing Juventus star?; Manchester United eyeing David Raum?; and MORE!
arts.sum: After an untimely red card, Bayern Munich had to play more than 75% of the game down a man, which was less than ideal against a squad like Bayer Leverkusen (yes, even an injured and not-quite-as-good-as-last-season version of Die Werkself ). Surprisingly, Bayern Munich did fairly well playing down a man, but it felt like Bayer Leverkusen was just treading water in preparation for an all-out attacking assault in the second half.

arts.ttl: “The better team doesn’t always win”: Joshua Kimmich remains upbeat after Bayern Munich bows out of DFB-Pokal in 1-0 loss to Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Bayern Munich were eager to make a deep push into the DFB-Pokal for the first time since the 2019/2020 season — when they trumped Bayer Leverkusen 4-2 to win the competition. Kimmich may have a point as Bayern managed to dominate possession and outshoot Xabi Alonso’s Leverkusen while playing majority of the game with ten men.

arts.ttl: Manuel Neuer stands up to face the music after howler in Bayern Munich defeat
arts.sum: In the first half of Bayern Munich ’s 0-1 DFB-Pokal defeat to Bayer Leverkusen, Neuer made a critical error in judgment. Manuel Neuer: "The red card decided the game.

arts.ttl: Neuer's first red card sees Bayern exit German Cup
arts.sum: Manuel Neuer was sent off for the first time and Bayern Munich crashed out of the German Cup with a third round loss at home to Bayer Leverkusen on Tuesday.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany full of praise for players and fans despite 1-0 loss to Bayer Leverkusen in DFB-Pokal round of 16
arts.sum: While being knocked out of a competition for the first time in the 2024/25 season is undoubtedly disappointing, Bayern manager Vincent Kompany still managed to find some positive takeaways from the game. Bayern Munich has suffered yet another early DFB-Pokal exit, this time a 1-0 defeat in the round of 16 at the hands of defending Bundesliga champions and title rivals, Bayer Leverkusen.

arts.ttl: Four Observations from Bayern Munich’s dramatic 1-0 loss to Bayer Leverkusen in the DFB-Pokal
arts.sum: Manuel Neuer’s early red card was too hard to overcome as Bayern Munich were eliminated in the DFB-Pokal. Outside of Musiala and Kane, the rest of the Bayern attack is simply not doing enough at the moment.

arts.ttl: Harry Kane's trophy woes continues as Bayern Munich team-mate sets unwanted record
arts.sum: Harry Kane was missing for Bayern on Tuesday night as he continues his recovery from a hamstring injury and could only watch on in frustration from the sidelines as his team-mates were beaten by Bayer Leverkusen

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s dismal DFB-Pokal night vs. Bayer Leverkusen
arts.sum: Long balls to test the spaces Bayern left behind were also a key part of the Leverkusen game plan, and Tah’s distribution stats — 10 long passes attempted, seven completed, per sofascore — stood out as well. Bayern easily could have gotten on the scoreboard without his interventions, including on Jamal Musiala and Serge Gnabry in moments of real danger in the second half.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works: Postgame Show — Bayern Munich 0-1 Bayer Leverkusen (DFB-Pokal)
arts.sum: Ultimately, Manuel Neuer picked up an early red card, which put Bayern Munich at a massive disadvantage for the match — allowing Bayer Leverkusen to escape with a 1-0 victory. Bayern Munich hosted Bayer Leverkusen in the DFB-Pokal in a knockout match that felt way too early these two powerhouses.
